description: From Latin convulsus, past participle of convellere (“to pluck up, dislocate, convulse”), from com- (“together”) + vellere (“to pluck, pull”). Doublet of convel.

verbs.description: convulse (third-person singular simple present convulses, present participle convulsing, simple past and past participle convulsed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To suffer violent involuntary contraction of the muscles, producing contortions of the body or limbs.
